Articles.Content: It may be late to join the project, but I have a fighter that you may want to use. Message me if I can help.
any word at all on this project?
just having a slow month i guess
right on, glad to see it's still here, I'm looking forward to how far you guys can take this
Well, I would have liked to work on the large ships like the mothership and battlecruisers, but this project seems like it is dead now...
its summer vacation that why it seems dead cause everybody is relaxing

People are posting and checking so it cant be dead. But the author have not posted sense the 8:e according to the profile so if its dead thats why. Seems like a lot of people are just waiting for a go ahead. I have already built my own duna base while waiting and that was weeks ago now.
I've talked with tada and he's relaxing
Im on no real hurry. Just good to know if its worth fiddling with the crafts.
you should start working on a laythe rover ,but it has to be completly stock and al least able to carry two kerbals
Already done with the fuel truck. Final specs for other crafts have not been given.
prepare a laythe descent and ascent vehicle that desn't need to use a lot a fuel, we need fuel economy.
do jets work on laythe?

do jets work on laythe?

yes they will work! Bring your space planes along!

yes they will work! Bring your space planes along!

Then jets are possibly the most economic way of getting mass to orbit I know of. VTOL of course with NERVA orbital engines. How much fuel is needed in orbit per launch?

Check the wiki.

And also can someone get in touch with tada? he's been quiet for two whole months.

Check the wiki.

And also can someone get in touch with tada? he's been quiet for two whole months.

to be honest, this project has seen no progress in so long that I do not think I will bother. good luck.

Hi, I just runned kinda low on time and the updates totally destroyed all ground structures on Laythe ...

Im slowly getting into KSP back again... Maybe I will introduce something similar, but better organized It went little bit over my head

I was wondering what happened. It seemed like you guys had made a lot of headway, but I didn't consider how old this project was and how many updates had taken place. Look forward to seeing the next project!
Well, I asure you, that your crafts will be 100% included! Sparrow SSTOs were the backbone of Laythe operation! They performed extremly well!

Well, thanks! I'm planning on making a Fat Sparrow Mk. II soon, the original failed my requirements of a ~51Ã‚Â° at 73km orbit (It's where I have my ISS analogue), and I'd like to fix that. But let me know if you would like tweaking in one way or another, or think you have a mission parameter you need designed around.

Just quick heads up:

I have idea to restart Project BABYLON. Previous project was mainly relying on addition of resources in next patch, which didnÃ‚Â´t happened and supply chain to Laythe was too long etc. Some of you suggested using Kethane mod and I was against it, but as time passed I ve tried B9 mod and Kethane and I must say I like them...

So what is general opinion on restarting this project with B9 pack + Kethane?

Any fans of Project BABYLON left?

Recently IÃ‚Â´ve been going trough this topic with great nostalgia, sadly I didnÃ‚Â´t had time to maintain the project due to my school + traveling duties. Plus the save file (all Laythe bases) got broken in update and it was just to hard to repair. But I wanted some kind of closure for the project, for all the people who provided the crafts, many hours of flying them into the space etc.

In near future I will present to you scenario for KSP 0.23 called:

Babylon: Derelict

It will feature redesigned locations, new ships and story to be uncovered.

Scenario is I would say 80% finished, just some final touches.
Go ahead tada , beacause there's a lot of people waiting to sbmit theri creations for the proyect

I'm reporting for duty if needed. I use Kethane but not B9 as I don't feel the B9 parts fit KSP that well. I do use KSPX quite often though.

If you need any new craft just say.
